alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 11 at 8:13PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Chama Above Abiquiu affecting Rio Arriba County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A DAM FLOODGATE RELEASE REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by upstream dam release continues. * WHERE...Rio Chama above Abiquiu. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM MDT Thursday the stage was 10.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to remain steady below flood stage at 10.4 feet. - Action stage is 10.2 feet. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (6 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Rio Chama Abiquiu 11.0 10.4 Thu 7 pm MDT 10.4 10.4 10.4 &&
info.instruction: To report flooding, contact your local law enforcement agency and your National Weather Service office when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Friday morning around 1000 AM MDT.
